definitions.definition: An amount obtained by the addition of smaller amounts.
definitions.example: A total of £145 was raised by the bring-and-buy stall.

definitions.definition: To add up; to calculate the sum of.
definitions.example: When we totalled the takings, we always got a different figure.

definitions.definition: To equal a total of; to amount to.
definitions.example: That totals seven times so far.

definitions.definition: To demolish; to wreck completely. (from total loss)
definitions.example: Honey, I’m OK, but I’ve totaled the car.

definitions.definition: To amount to; to add up to.
Entire; relating to the whole of something.
definitions.example: The total book is rubbish from start to finish.  The total number of votes cast is 3,270.
